dt: {bc}a place in which public records or historical materials (such as documents) are preserved
{bc}a repository or collection especially of information

et: French & Latin; French, from Latin {it}archivum{/it}, from Greek {it}archeion{/it} government house (in plural, official documents), from {it}archē{/it} rule, government {ma}{mat|arch-|}{/ma}
shortdef: a place in which public records or historical materials (such as documents) are preserved; also : the material preserved —often used in plural
a repository or collection especially of information

dt: {bc}to file or collect in or as if in an archive

shortdef: to file or collect in or as if in an archive
